bibl.title: New Literary Papyri from the Michigan Collection. Mythographic Lyric and a Catalogue of Poetic First Lines
bibl.note: Introduction: Institutional History from Egypt to Partial Publication. - Part 1. A List of Lyric and Tragic Incipits: P. Mich. Inv. 3498 recto [= M.-P.3 1596.1; LDAB 7079] + 3250b recto, 3250a and c recto. Provenance unknown, II BCE. - Part 2. New Fragments of Euripidean Lyric: P. Mich. Inv. 3498 verso [= M.-P.3 1937.1; LDAB 6879] + 3250b verso and P. Mich. Inv. 3250c verso. Late III to mid-II BCE - Part 3. P. Mich. Inv. 3250a verso. Problematic fragment, bearing two texts apparently without continuity: the first involves an agricultural context, while the second is more mythological. Perhaps a prose work involving an erotic context of some sort. Late III to II BCE. - Bibliography. Index Locorum. General Index.
bibl.seg: 141.4 364 Carmina varia Graeca Euripides Prosa varia Tragica
Cassandra Borges & C. Michael Sampson, New Literary Papyri from the Michigan Collection. Mythographic Lyric and a Catalogue of Poetic First Lines = New Texts from Ancient Cultures.
Ann Arbor, University of Michigan Press, 2012, 8Â°, xviii-171 pp., 3 figg. et 6 pll. ISBN 978-0-472-11807-6. $65.

Introduction: Institutional History from Egypt to Partial Publication. - Part 1. A List of Lyric and Tragic Incipits: P. Mich. Inv. 3498 recto [= M.-P.3 1596.1; LDAB 7079] + 3250b recto, 3250a and c recto. Provenance unknown, II BCE. - Part 2. New Fragments of Euripidean Lyric: P. Mich. Inv. 3498 verso [= M.-P.3 1937.1; LDAB 6879] + 3250b verso and P. Mich. Inv. 3250c verso. Late III to mid-II BCE - Part 3. P. Mich. Inv. 3250a verso. Problematic fragment, bearing two texts apparently without continuity: the first involves an agricultural context, while the second is more mythological. Perhaps a prose work involving an erotic context of some sort. Late III to II BCE. - Bibliography. Index Locorum. General Index.
